name: Fcb.Concept.Confidentiality.ClassificationCategoryTagCodeTypeEnumeration
descriptions:
A category tag that restricts and/or expands the dissemination of information within the scope of the classification.
Remarks:
The values are defined by the security policy authority in force. 
The values specified in the MIM are the ones used within NATO. However, nations may share information in a NATO-led operation with a specific national classification. Accordingly, the code is extensible rather than complete.
Used to indicate the sensitive nature of certain information not conveyed by the Ownership or Classification; meaning that it is subject to additional stringent security regulations and procedures.
Used to indicate discretionary handling according to local, non-automated procedures or provide guidance about the disposition of information.
Used in combination with the Governing Security Policy context to indicate the \"Ownership\" of information.
Used to restrict or limit the dissemination of information to specific entities and a sub-set of the entities within the context for which that information was created.
Used to expand the dissemination of information to additional entities outside of the context for which that information was created.
